info.title: Azure Blob Storage
info.description: Microsoft Azure Storage provides a massively scalable, durable, and highly available storage for data on the cloud, and serves as the data storage solution for modern applications. Connect to Blob Storage to perform various operations such as create, update, get and delete on blobs in your Azure Storage account.

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a blob is added in a container. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Select a container.

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: Infer content-type based on extension.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it work now, add a blob in the container you selected

get.description: This operation triggers a flow when a blob is added or modified in a container. The trigger will fetch both the file metadata as well as the content of the file. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Select a container.

parameters.name: includeFileContent
parameters.description: If set to true, file content will also be retrieved along with the trigger response.

parameters.name: inferContentType
parameters.description: Infer content-type based on extension.

get.x-ms-trigger-hint: To see it works now, add or change a blob in the container you selected

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

get.summary: When a blob is added or modified (properties only) (V2)
get.description: This operation triggers a flow when one or more blobs are added or modified in a container. This trigger will only fetch the file metadata. To get the file content, you can use the \"Get file content\" operation. The trigger does not fire if a file is added/updated in a subfolder. If it is required to trigger on subfolders, multiple triggers should be created.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: folderId
parameters.description: Select a container.

parameters.name: maxFileCount
parameters.description: Maximum number of blobs to return from the trigger (1-100).

parameters.name: checkBothCreatedAndModifiedDateTime
parameters.description: If the flag is set to true, the trigger will check the file's created date and time and the file's last modified date and time. If the flag is set to false, the trigger will only check the file's last modified date and time.

get.description: This operation retrieves blob metadata using blob id.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the blob.

put.description: This operation updates a blob in Azure Blob Storage.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the blob to update.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Specify the content of the blob to update.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Specify content-type of the blob to upload.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is updated. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the blob to delete.

parameters.name: SkipDeleteIfFileNotFoundOnServer
parameters.description: Skips the deletion if a file is not found on the server.

patch.description: This operation appends to a blob.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Specify the blob to append to.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Specify the content of the blob to append.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file is appended. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Specify unique path to the blob.

parameters.description: Specify the blob.

post.description: This operation uploads a blob to Azure Blob Storage.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: folderPath
parameters.description: Specify folder path to upload.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Specify name of the blob to create.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Specify the content of the blob to upload.

parameters.name: Content-Type
parameters.description: Specify content-type of the blob to upload.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file creation is complete. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file creation is complete. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

post.description: This operation copies a blob. If blob is being deleted/renamed on server right after it was copied, connector may return HTTP 404 error by it's design. Please use a delay for 1 minute before deleting or renaming newly created blob. Chunk transfer is not supported in this action. If source and destination are present in same storage account, please use relative path. Otherwise, maximum size of a source for copy blob operation is 50 MB.

parameters.name: dataset
parameters.description: Azure Storage account name or blob endpoint.
parameters.x-ms-summary: Storage account name or blob endpoint

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Specify the url to source blob.

parameters.name: destination
parameters.description: Specify the destination blob path, including the target blob name.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Should the destination blob be overwritten (true/false)?.

parameters.name: ReadFileMetadataFromServer
parameters.description: Get all file metadata from the server after file creation is complete. If this is false, some metadata properties may not be returned such as last modified time, etc.

parameters.name: overwrite
parameters.description: Should destination blob be overwritten (true/false)?.

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

LastModifiedBy.description: The author of the last modification.

Id.description: The unique id of the file or folder.

Name.description: The name of the file or folder.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the file or folder.

Path.description: The path of the file or folder.

LastModified.description: The date and time the file or folder was last modified.

Size.description: The size of the file or folder.

MediaType.description: The media type of the file or folder.

IsFolder.description: A boolean value (true, false) to indicate whether or not the blob is a folder.

ETag.description: The etag of the file or folder.

FileLocator.description: The filelocator of the file or folder.

BlobMetadataPage.description: Represents a page of blob metadata.

nextLink.description: An Url which can be used to retrieve the next page.

nextPageMarker.description: A marker which can be used to retrieve the next page.

SharedAccessSignatureBlobPolicy.description: The set of parameters to generate a SAS link.

GroupPolicyIdentifier.description: The string identifying a stored access policy. The Group policy parameters (e.g. Start time and End time) have precedence over input parameters mentioned in actions.

Permissions.description: The permissions specified on the SAS (Values separated by comma).

StartTime.description: The date and time at which the SAS becomes valid (example: '2017-11-01T15:30:00+00:00'). Default = now().

ExpiryTime.description: The date and time after which the SAS is no longer valid (example: '2017-12-01T15:30:00+00:00'). Default = now() + 24h.

AccessProtocol.description: The allowed protocols (https only, or http and https). Null if you don't want to restrict protocol.

IpAddressOrRange.description: The allowed IP address or IP address range. Null if you don't want to restrict based on IP address.
IpAddressOrRange.x-ms-summary: IP address or IP address range

WebUrl.description: A URL to an object with access token.

Name.description: The name of the storage account.

DisplayName.description: The display name of the storage account.
